But it was among the first education schemes to be cut back by the coalition's Education Secretary Michael Gove , who said the programme had been beset by massive overspends, tragic delays, botched construction projects and needless bureaucracy . Free schools are approved by the secretary of state, with no requirement for groups setting them up to consult widely with the local population.
